intro: Kibara angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf kibara, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The flowers attract various pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
